metadata.titel_preek: Sermon 38: Third Sermon for the Easter Season

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Cosmic Restoration: Christ descends from heaven to the netherworld to defeat the Devil and liberate humanity, establishing a kingdom of gems (saints) and returning as Judge/King.

tekstueel_bewijs: Christ Jesus painted it on our minds
Jesus won the victory over his mighty and brutal adversary
He then descended to the netherworld and forced it to release his chosen ones

object.identificatie: Salvation and the Restoration of the 'Lost Treasures'
tekstueel_bewijs: what lost treasures it has restored
to those he has regenerated, salvation
it is God who commands us to celebrate this great day

ontvanger.identificatie: Mankind / The Chosen Ones / The Church
tekstueel_bewijs: to us also he has promised resurrection
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (beneficiary of the victory).

tekstueel_bewijs: triumphed over the devil... by the radiance of his cross
distinct heavenly virtues protected under the shield of devotion
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject, not merely a helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit as the 'fragrance' or 'principle' radiating from Christ's heart.

tegenstander.identificatie: Satan / The Devil / Death / The Cruelty of the Jews
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is an armed supernatural foe and the power of the netherworld, requiring a divine intervention.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Response of Faith: The hearer must hold fast to belief to merit the eternal reward.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / 'My brothers'
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program (Christ's victory) provides the possibility; the secondary program (human belief) secures the merit.

voorbeelden_god_subject: Christ Jesus painted it on our minds
He then descended to the netherworld
voorbeelden_mens_subject: let us hold fast to this belief

voorbeelden: God who commands us to celebrate
nobody who wants to be healthy
forced it to release his chosen ones

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on Christ's 'ability' (Pouvoir) to overcome cosmic enemies and transform human nature, rather than the hearer's 'obligation' (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Movement from the hidden mysteries (~S1) to the victory of the Cross (S1), then to the warning of the Second Coming (S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Doctor' phase (Grace) preceding the 'King' phase (Justice).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the Second Coming is described as 'fearsome' for rebels.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is overwhelmingly theocentric. Christ is the active subject of almost all transformative verbs. Human action is relegated to a responsive 'holding fast'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: so that we may merit to live eternally

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus won the victory over his mighty and brutal adversary
to corpses he gives living souls

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Patriarchs, Apostles) are not models for behavior but gems adorning Christ's body.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: They are 'adorned by the Lord' rather than examples to be imitated.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Awe and gratitude toward the Divine Hero.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation with a synergistic response of perseverance.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from Christ's past victory to his future judgment is logically handled through the metaphor of the Doctor and the King.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'meriting' eternal life and the 'gift' of salvation to corpses.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: In this combat of Christ against Satan... Jesus won the victory

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'radiating love' acts as an endowment of competence.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; described as a 'brutal adversary' and 'netherworld' captivity.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is purely theocentric. Christ is the Subject; humanity is the Object/Receiver. The structure is a classic 'Divine Rescue' plot.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: None; God is already the subject.

identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Maintain identification as the 'chosen ones' released from the netherworld.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Continue emphasizing the 'corpse to living soul' transformation.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Integrate more 'Vouloir' (desire) to bridge the gap between the victory and the final 'merit'.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Describe how Christ's victory specifically changes the hearer's will.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The word 'merit' in the final sentence risks collapsing the hierarchy back into a works-based conclusion.
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Clarify that 'holding fast' is also a gift/fruit of the 'radiating love' mentioned in §1.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. It avoids the trap of exemplarism by turning biblical figures into Christ's own regalia.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'gem' metaphors, semiotics reveals that these gems are passive actants (Receivers) of Christ's glory.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the context of Mt 5:15; semiotics shows how the 'lampstand' is actantially repurposed as the Cross.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'Doctor' and 'King' are the same Actor playing two different Actantial roles (Helper vs. Sender/Judge) to manage the transition from Grace to Justice.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses high-register imagery to maintain the 'Subject' status of the Divine.
